smells.name: LongMethod
smells.description: One method should have one responsibility. Long methods tend to handle many things at once. Prefer smaller methods to make them easier to understand.

instances.message: The function onViewCreated is too long. The maximum length is 20.

smells.name: ComplexMethod
smells.description: Prefer splitting up complex methods into smaller, easier to understand methods.

instances.message: The function onViewCreated appears to be too complex.
The function showSupportDialog appears to be too complex.
The function onCreate appears to be too complex.
The function onCreateDialog appears to be too complex.

smells.description: Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.

smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

instances.message: Class 'SettingsActivity' with '11' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'LimitService' with '18' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'FloatingView' with '13' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Object 'Utils' with '14' functions detected. Defined threshold inside objects is set to '11'
Class 'OsmLimitProvider' with '11' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'

smells.name: LargeClass
smells.description: One class should have one responsibility. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. Split up large classes into smaller classes that are easier to understand.

instances.message: Class LimitService is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.
Class FloatingView is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.

smells.name: NestedBlockDepth
smells.description: Excessive nesting leads to hidden complexity. Prefer extracting code to make it easier to understand.

instances.message: Function verifyPurchase is nested too deeply.
Function onTouch is nested too deeply.
Function isAccessibilityServiceEnabled is nested too deeply.

smells.name: ComplexCondition
smells.description: Complex conditions should be simplified and extracted into well-named methods if necessary.

instances.message: This condition is too complex.
This condition is too complex.
This condition is too complex.
This condition is too complex.

smells.name: LongParameterList
smells.description: The more parameters a method has the more complex it is. Long parameter lists are often used to control complex algorithms and violate the Single Responsibility Principle. Prefer methods with short parameter lists.

instances.message: The function getTomtom has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.
The function getHere has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.

smells.description: Empty block of code detected. As they serve no purpose they should be removed.

smells.name: PrintStackTrace
smells.description: Do not print an stack trace. These debug statements should be replaced with a logger or removed.

instances.message: Do not print an stack trace. These debug statements should be replaced with a logger or removed.

smells.name: MemberNameEqualsClassName
smells.description: A member should not given the same name as its parent class or object.

instances.message: A member is named after the class. This might result in confusion. Either rename the member or change it to a constructor.

smells.name: VariableNaming
smells.description: Variable names should follow the naming convention set in the projects configuration.

instances.message: Private variable names should match the pattern: (_)?[a-z][A-Za-z0-9]*

smells.name: SpreadOperator
smells.description: Using a spread operator causes a full copy of the array to be created before calling a method has a very high performance penalty.

smells.name: WildcardImport
smells.description: Wildcard imports should be replaced with imports using fully qualified class names. Wildcard imports can lead to naming conflicts. A library update can introduce naming clashes with your classes which results in compilation errors.

instances.message: android.widget.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
kotlinx.coroutines.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
kotlinx.coroutines.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.

android.view.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
androidx.room.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
com.pluscubed.velociraptor.api.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
retrofit2.http.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

smells.name: SpacingBetweenPackageAndImports
smells.description: Violation of the package declaration style.

instances.message: There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of ChangelogDialogFragment.

smells.name: ForbiddenComment
smells.description: Flags a forbidden comment. Defaults values are TODO:, FIXME: or STOPSHIP:

instances.message: This comment contains text that has been defined as forbidden in detekt.

smells.name: RedundantVisibilityModifierRule
smells.description: Checks for redundant visibility modifiers. Public is the default visibility for classes. The public modifier is redundant.

instances.message: clear is explicitly marked as public. Functions are public by default so this modifier is redundant.

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message:
Parentheses in (
                    if (debuggingEnabled)
                        "\nOSM Info:\n--" + TextUtils.join("\n--", osmOverpassApis)
                    else
                        ""
                    ) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: if (debuggingEnabled)
                        "\nOSM Info:\n--" + TextUtils.join("\n--", osmOverpassApis)
                    else
                        ""

smells.name: CollapsibleIfStatements
smells.description: Two if statements which could be collapsed were detected. These statements can be merged to improve readability.

instances.message: Two if statements which could be collapsed were detected. These statements can be merged to improve readability.

smells.name: DataClassContainsFunctions
smells.description: Data classes should mainly be used to store data and should not have any extra functions. (Compiler will automatically generate equals, toString and hashCode functions)

instances.message: The data class LimitResponse contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called initDebugInfo
